alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 11 at 3:17AM MDT until April 11 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected, except 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 65 mph between Ferndale and Swan Lake. For the Wind Advisory, east winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph expected. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to 9 AM MDT Tuesday. For the Wind Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 4 PM MDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
